intro: Aulaxis nuda, commonly known as the naked aulaxis, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its slender, aromatic stems. The plant produces small, white or greenish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. Its leaves are finely divided and have a mild, spicy scent. Aulaxis nuda is often found in dry, rocky soils and is adapted to thrive in sunny, well-drained environments.
